statement: Given triangle \( ABC \) with circumcircle \( \Gamma \) and incentre \( I \), the incircle touches sides \( BC, CA, AB \) at \( D, E, F \) respectively. Let \( K \) be the intersection of \( AI \) with \( \Gamma \) again. Prove that the line \( DK \) is tangent to \( \Gamma \).
Let \( p \) be a prime number. Prove that there exists a prime number \( q \) such that for every integer \( n \), the number \( n^p - n \) is divisible by \( q \).

Let \( x_1, x_2, \dots, x_n \) be real numbers such that \( x_1 + x_2 + \dots + x_n = 0 \) and \( x_1^2 + x_2^2 + \dots + x_n^2 = 1 \). Prove that
\[ \max(x_1, x_2, \dots, x_n) \geq \frac{1}{\sqrt{n - 1}}. \]

In triangle \( ABC \), the bisector of angle \( A \) meets side \( BC \) at \( D \). The circumcircle of triangle \( ABD \) meets \( AC \) again at \( E \). Prove that \( DE \) is tangent to the circumcircle of triangle \( ACD \).
In a group of \( n \) people, each pair of people are either friends or enemies. Prove that there exists a person such that the number of his friends is at least the number of his enemies.

Let \( a_1, a_2, \dots \) be an infinite sequence of integers satisfying \( 1 \leq a_j \leq 1997 \) for all \( j \geq 1 \) and \( a_k + k \neq a_l + l \) for all \( 1 \leq k < l \). Prove that there exist positive integers \( b \) and \( N \) such that
\[ \biggl|\sum_{j = m + 1}^n (a_j - b)\biggr| \leq 1000 \]
for all integers \( m \) and \( n \) with \( n > m > N \).
